title-group.article-title: An Analysis of Daily Patterns in Stock Returns across Indices: Spot versus Futures

abstract.p: This paper presents an empirical examination of daily patterns in stock returns across indices of varying market capitalization. The analysis is extended to the market for stock index futures. The spot results are similar to those reported by Harris [6] on a close-to-close basis with one major exception; a well-defined pattern across indices was noted on Monday and found to be absent on Wednesday. No evidence of anomalous patterns in time-decomposed returns across indices was noted for futures prices. An analysis of close-to-hourly open and hourly open-to-close returns for the S& P 500 and VL spot suggests that the patterns in time-decomposed returns documented by Harris [6] across firm size were driven exclusively by market activity during the first few minutes of trading.
